stanza.line: No Time thou shalt not boast that I do (a)change(/a)
Thy pyramids built up with newer (b)might(/b)
To me are nothing novel nothing (a)strange(/a)
They are but dressings Of a former (b)sight(/b)
Our dates are brief and therefore we (c)admire(/c)
What thou dost foist upon us that is (d)old(/d)
And rather make them born to our (c)desire(/c)
Than think that we before have heard them (d)told(/d)
Thy registers and thee I both (e)defy(/e)
Not wond'ring at the present nor the (f)past(/f)
For thy records and what we see doth (e)lie(/e)
Made more or less by thy continual (f)haste(/f)
This I do vow and this shall ever (g)be(/g)
I will be true despite thy scythe and (g)thee(/g)
